title: Training
description: Establishes comprehensive training requirements for harvest crew including food safety hygiene training, sanitation worker training, illness reporting procedures, and documentation of training events and corrective actions

requirements.text: Is there a food safety hygiene training program covering new and existing workers and are there records of these training events?
mandatoryStatements: Food safety hygiene training program is documented
Program covers new workers before they start work
Program includes refresher training for existing workers
Training content addresses personal hygiene, handwashing, illness reporting, and food safety practices
Training is provided in languages understood by workers
Records document date, topics covered, trainer, and attendees
Training attendance is verified through sign-in sheets or equivalent
Training effectiveness is evaluated
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that all workers have received required training, annual review of training program content and effectiveness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification that new workers complete training before starting work, monthly review of training completion rates, observation of worker practices to confirm training effectiveness

requirements.text: Is there a documented training program with training logs for the sanitation workers, including best practices and chemical use details?
mandatoryStatements: Documented training program exists for sanitation workers
Training covers sanitation best practices and procedures
Training includes proper chemical use, dilution, and application
Training addresses personal protective equipment (PPE) requirements
Training covers chemical safety and emergency response
Training logs document dates, topics, trainers, and attendees
Competency of sanitation workers is verified
Refresher training is provided at defined intervals
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification of sanitation worker training completion and competency, annual review of training program and chemical use procedures
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Observation of sanitation practices to verify training effectiveness, immediate retraining if improper procedures observed

requirements.text: Are there written and communicated procedures in place that require food handlers to report any cuts or grazes and/or if they are suffering any illnesses that might be a contamination risk to the products being produced, and return to work requirements? (In countries with health privacy/confidentiality laws, e.g., USA, auditors can check procedure/policy but not the actual records).
mandatoryStatements: Written procedures require reporting of cuts, grazes, and illnesses
Procedures identify illnesses that pose contamination risk (gastrointestinal illness, jaundice, infected wounds, etc.)
Procedures specify to whom workers must report health issues
Return to work requirements are clearly defined
Procedures are communicated to all food handlers
Procedures are available in languages understood by workers
Workers acknowledge understanding of reporting requirements
Confidentiality of health information is maintained per applicable laws
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of illness reporting procedures for completeness and regulatory compliance, quarterly verification of procedure communication to workers
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily supervisor observation for signs of illness or injury, immediate response to reported health issues, verification that ill/injured workers are appropriately excluded or restricted

requirements.text: Are there worker food safety non-conformance records and associated corrective actions (including retraining records)?
mandatoryStatements: System exists to document worker food safety non-conformances
Records identify specific violation, date, and worker involved
Corrective actions are documented for each non-conformance
Retraining is provided when non-conformances indicate knowledge gaps
Retraining records are maintained
Progressive disciplinary measures are applied for repeated violations
Effectiveness of corrective actions is verified
Trends in non-conformances are analyzed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly review of non-conformance records and corrective action completion, quarterly analysis of non-conformance trends
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation of observed non-conformances, verification that corrective actions and retraining are completed within defined timeframes

capaInject: If untrained workers found in harvest operations: immediate removal from food handling duties, complete training before return to work
If training program gaps identified: revise program within 14 days, retrain affected workers within 30 days
If sanitation workers lack chemical use training: immediate removal from sanitation duties, complete training before return to duties
If illness reporting violations: immediate retraining, increased supervision, escalate for repeated failures
If non-conformances not documented or addressed: immediate documentation, complete corrective actions within 48 hours, review of monitoring effectiveness
traceabilityInject: Training records must be traceable to specific workers, dates, topics, and trainers
Sanitation worker training must be traceable to specific chemical use authorizations
Non-conformance records must be traceable to specific incidents, workers, and corrective actions
Retraining must be traceable to specific non-conformances or knowledge gaps identified
